question: First tree species to exceed 300 feet in height?
description: The Coast Redwood (Sequoia sempervirens) in California often grows over 300 feet tall.

question: First person to invent a practical telephone?
description: Bell patented the telephone in 1876, transforming global communication.

question: First country to host the modern Olympics?
description: Greece hosted the 1896 Summer Olympics in Athens, reviving the ancient tradition.

question: First desert recognized as the largest by area?
description: Spanning 13.8 million square kilometers, it’s the largest due to low precipitation.

question: First woman to fly solo across the Atlantic?
description: Earhart made the historic flight in 1932, inspiring aviators worldwide.

question: First ancient wonder attributed to Babylon?
description: Debated in existence, it’s one of the Seven Wonders linked to Babylon.

question: First planet discovered with the most moons?
description: As of 2023, Saturn has 145 known moons, outnumbering others.

question: First person to write a computer algorithm?
description: In 1843, Lovelace’s notes on the Analytical Engine marked the first algorithm.

question: First feature-length animated film released?
answer: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
description: Disney’s 1937 release set the benchmark for animation.

question: First empire to build Machu Picchu?
description: Constructed in the 15th century, it showcases Incan ingenuity.

question: First gas identified as the most abundant in Earth’s atmosphere?
description: Nitrogen makes up 78% of the atmosphere by volume.

question: First person to reach the South Pole?
description: The Norwegian reached it in 1911, outpacing Robert Scott.

question: First university established in the world?
description: Founded in 859 AD in Morocco, it remains active today.

question: First country to win the most FIFA World Cups?
description: Brazil secured 5 victories by 2023, leading the pack.

question: First antibiotic discovered?
description: Alexander Fleming found it in 1928, changing medicine forever.

question: First artist to paint the Sistine Chapel ceiling?
description: Completed from 1508 to 1512, it’s a Renaissance icon.

question: First land animal to achieve speeds over 60 mph?
description: Cheetahs hit 60-70 mph in short bursts.

question: First spacecraft to land humans on the Moon?
description: Armstrong and Aldrin landed on July 20, 1969.

question: First emperor of the Roman Empire?
description: Ruling from 27 BC, he initiated the Pax Romana.

question: First river identified as the longest in South America?
description: The Amazon spans over 6,575 km across multiple nations.

question: First person to develop a practical light bulb?
description: Edison’s 1879 incandescent bulb lit up the world.

question: First country with over 70% desert coverage?
description: More than 70% of Australia is arid or semi-arid.

question: First video game created?
description: Developed by William Higinbotham in 1958, it predates Pong.

question: First scientist to formulate the law of gravity?
description: Newton published it in 1687, shaping physics.

question: First building to exceed 800 meters in height?
description: Completed in 2010, it stands at 829.8 meters in Dubai.

question: First explorer to circumnavigate the globe?
description: His expedition finished the journey from 1519 to 1522.

question: First organ identified as the largest in the human body?
description: Skin covers about 20 square feet on average.

question: First woman to win a Nobel Prize?
description: Curie won in 1903 for her radioactivity research.

question: First point recognized as the deepest in the ocean?
description: In the Pacific, it plunges to 36,070 feet.

question: First country to invent tea?
description: Tea’s origins trace back to China around 2737 BC.

question: First composer of the 'Moonlight Sonata'?
description: Completed in 1801, it’s a renowned piano piece.

question: First mammal to reach 100 feet in length?
description: Blue whales can grow up to 100 feet and weigh 200 tons.

question: First country to grant women suffrage?
description: Women gained the vote in 1893, a pioneering move.

question: First aircraft to achieve powered flight?
description: The Wright brothers flew it in 1903 for 12 seconds.

question: First dynasty to construct the Great Wall of China?
description: Begun in 221 BC, it was later expanded.

question: First star identified as the brightest in the night sky?
description: Sirius in Canis Major outshines all other stars.

question: First scientist to discover penicillin?
description: Fleming’s 1928 find revolutionized medicine.

question: First written language developed?
description: Used in Mesopotamia around 3100 BC.

question: First team to win the Super Bowl?
description: They beat the Chiefs in 1967, launching the event.

question: First volcano recognized as the largest on Earth?
description: In Hawaii, it’s the biggest by volume and area.

question: First climbers to summit Mount Everest?
description: They reached the top in 1953.

question: First country established as the smallest by area?
description: At 0.44 square kilometers, it’s a tiny city-state.

question: First person to improve the steam engine?
description: Watt’s 1765 design spurred the Industrial Revolution.

question: First coral reef system identified as the largest?
description: Over 2,300 km long, it’s off Australia’s coast.

question: First director of 'Citizen Kane'?
description: Released in 1941, it’s a cinematic milestone.

question: First element discovered on the Sun before Earth?
description: Found in 1868 via solar spectroscopy.

question: First president of the United States?
description: Inaugurated in 1789, he served two terms.

question: First substance identified as the hardest natural material?
description: Carbon-based, it ranks 10 on the Mohs scale.

question: First civilization to build the Giza pyramids?
description: Constructed around 2630 BC for pharaohs.

question: First language to reach over 1 billion native speakers?
description: Achieved by 2023, it’s the most spoken language.

question: First film to win the Academy Award for Best Picture?
description: The 1929 silent film won at the first Oscars.

question: First lake identified as the largest by freshwater volume?
description: In Siberia, it holds 20% of global freshwater.

question: First person to sail solo around the world?
description: Completed in 1898 aboard the Spray.

question: First source of energy identified for Earth?
description: Solar energy powers climate and life.

question: First person to invent the printing press?
description: Introduced in 1440, it transformed publishing.

question: First mountain identified as the tallest in the solar system?
description: On Mars, it rises 21.9 km high.

question: First country with over 200,000 islands?
description: Sweden has over 221,800 islands.

question: First African to win the Nobel Peace Prize?
description: Won in 1960 for non-violent resistance.

question: First bird with a wingspan over 11 feet?
description: Its wingspan reaches up to 11.5 feet.

question: First scientist to create the theory of relativity?
description: Published in 1905 and 1915, it redefined physics.

question: First national park established worldwide?
description: Created in 1872 in the United States.

question: First woman to travel into space?
description: She orbited Earth in 1963 on Vostok 6.

question: First musical instrument discovered?
description: A 43,000-year-old flute found in Germany.

question: First country to amass over 2,800 Olympic medals?
description: Achieved by 2023, leading globally.

question: First element identified as most abundant in the universe?
description: It comprises 75% of baryonic mass.

question: First pilot to cross the Atlantic solo?
description: Completed in 1927, a landmark in aviation.

question: First pyramid recognized as the largest by volume?
description: In Mexico, it exceeds Giza in volume.

question: First person to invent the radio?
description: Marconi transmitted signals in 1895.

question: First location to record a temperature below -89°C?
description: In Antarctica, it hit -89.2°C in 1983.

question: First European to reach India by sea?
description: Arrived in 1498, establishing a trade route.

question: First city to exceed 37 million in population?
description: Reached by 2023 in its metro area.

question: First author of 'Pride and Prejudice'?
description: Published in 1813, a timeless novel.

question: First shark species to grow over 40 feet?
description: A filter feeder reaching up to 40 feet.

question: First country to win the Rugby World Cup?
description: The All Blacks won in 1987.

question: First scientist to discover X-rays?
description: In 1895, he advanced medical imaging.

question: First waterfall identified as the tallest worldwide?
description: In Venezuela, it drops 979 meters.

question: First human to orbit Earth?
description: The Soviet cosmonaut orbited in 1961.

question: First bridge still standing from the 1st century AD?
description: Built in Portugal around 100 AD.

question: First person to patent the automobile?
description: Benz’s 1886 motorcar started the automotive era.

question: First island recognized as the largest by area?
description: Spans 2.13 million square kilometers.

question: First female prime minister in the world?
description: Led Sri Lanka starting in 1960.

question: First bird to dive at speeds over 200 mph?
description: Reaches up to 240 mph in a dive.

question: First composer of 'The Four Seasons'?
description: Written in 1723, a Baroque classic.

question: First patient to receive a successful heart transplant?
description: Performed by Christiaan Barnard in 1967.

question: First country with a coastline over 243,000 km?
description: Due to its vast number of islands.

question: First explorer to reach the North Pole?
description: Claimed in 1909, though debated.

question: First stadium to hold over 114,000 people?
description: In North Korea, built in 1989.

question: First person credited with inventing the microscope?
description: Developed around 1590 in the Netherlands.

question: First planet identified as the hottest in the solar system?
description: Reaches 475°C due to its thick atmosphere.

question: First country to exceed 400 Nobel laureates?
description: Achieved by 2023, leading the world.

question: First pilot to break the sound barrier?
description: Flew the X-1 in 1947 at Mach 1.

question: First city inhabited since 9000 BC?
description: Located in the West Bank, one of the oldest.

question: First person to invent the World Wide Web?
description: Proposed in 1989, launched in 1991.

question: First fish species to weigh over 20 tons?
description: Can reach up to 20 tons in weight.

question: First country to host the Winter Olympics?
description: Held in Chamonix in 1924.

question: First scientist to discover blood circulation?
description: Published in 1628, a medical breakthrough.

question: First desert identified as the largest excluding polar regions?
description: Covers 9.2 million square kilometers in Africa.

question: First object to photograph Earth from space?
description: Launched by the US in 1946, unmanned.

question: First board game known from ancient times?
description: Played in Egypt around 3100 BC.

question: First doctor to use anesthesia in surgery?
description: Performed in 1842 with ether.
